FacilityName: Eberhart Farm Center, Inc. - Maquoketa Plant
SafetyInspectionBy: Iowa Department of Ag & Land Stewardship

_prev_prog_2.FR_OtherType: Applicable building, electrical and plumbing codes. This facility complies with the Iowa Fertilizer Law.
_prev_prog_2.FR_Comments: We utilize those portions of these codes which are deemed applicable by the jurisdictional authority
_prev_prog_2.MH_OtherType: Theft-Vandalism-Vehicular Damage - potential leaking from underground piping
_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: breakaway couplers for pullaway protection, remote emergency shutoff valve
_prev_prog_2.MS_OtherType: Routine plant inspection/Routine preventive maintenance & repair
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: liquid pump, storage valves, relief valves, riser breakaway valves, plumbing, and anhydrous hoses - pumps, pump seals, pipes and plumbing, electrical equipment and safety equipment
_prev_prog_2.Description: Anhydrous Ammonia Storage. The plan is to minimize those hazards to human health and to the environment that are associated with accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. Employees working at the bulk storage plant make routine observations prior to and during transfer operations of anhydrous ammonia from the storage vessels to nurse tanks. In so doing, they are able to detect problems before they arise. This routine inspection identifies any portion of the system which may be under stress or about to fail. Repairs can be made before they become problematic. Employees are annually trained to recognize the hazards associated with the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia. In addition to annual training for employees who have been on the job for a number of years, the company conducts training on new hires. This training includes classroom instruction, on-site training at the plant, and follow-up observation to determine the comprehension and understanding of the new hire. Finally, the company routinely invites local fire department personnel to visit the site. In the event that the local fire department requests assistance in training its personnel on anhydrous ammonia, the company cooperates fully in their endeavors.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The owners, management, and employees of this facility are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  This facility complies with the Iowa Department of Ag and Land Stewardship's requirements for anhydrous ammonia storage and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia should occur, it is our policy to notify the City of Maquoketa Fire Department and the Jackson County LEPC and request that they respond to the emergency to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and environment.

This facility is a retail fertilizer plant.  We sell fertilizer and pesticides to area farmers.  Anhydrous is used as a form of nitrogen for crop use.  Our storage system consists of one 18,000 gallon tank with plumbing.

This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The anhydrous system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with the Iowa Department of Ag & Land Stewardship.

This facility has never had an accident involving anhydrous that caused death, injury, property or enviromental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.

This facility has an emergency action plan.  In the event of an anhydrous ammonia emergency, it is our policy to notify the City of Maquoketa Fire Department and the Jackson County LEPC.  Employees should evacuate the area.

Safety is an ongoing effort with the administration and employees working hand and hand to promote safety through training and continued effort to maintain the facility.

The primary emergency coordinator for the Maquoketa, Iowa location is Charles Eberhard. His work and 24-hour emergency response telephone numbers are provided in the Registration Section of this document.
